TopicTitle: Is there a way to hide threads posted by an ignored user?

Articles.Content: I know i can ignore posts of users, so they dont clutter up threads. But is it possible to hide all threads opened by a specific user, so they dont clutter up a subforum?
Why would you want to do that?
I can't think of anyone that makes enough threads to clutter up a subforum.  What happens when someone you have hidden makes a thread?

7 hours ago, Geonovast said:

I can't think of anyone that makes enough threads to clutter up a subforum.  What happens when someone you have hidden makes a thread? 

Well, i know someone. The threads still appear normal, if i click them the first post isnt shown.

 

7 hours ago, The Dunatian said:

Why would you want to do that? 

Because there is someone writting nonsense threads which are not against the rules, but annoying me. I know this person wont ever write something ill want to read so i want to get rid of him in my visible forum...
Sorry, the software does not provide for this.
